item.title: Jason add a quote by Hafiz
Jason add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "Time is a game played beautifully by children." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Jason add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Jason add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "The most sophisticated people I know - inside they are all children. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "People say that what we’re all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think that’s what we’re really seeking. I think that what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive, so that our life experiences on the purely physical plane will have resonances with our own innermost being and reality, so that we actually feel the rapture of being alive." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jason add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "California deserves whatever it gets. Californians invented the concept of life-style. This alone warrants their doom." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Jason add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "Oscar Wilde said that sunsets were not valued because we could not pay for sunsets. But Oscar Wilde was wrong; we can pay for sunsets. We can pay for them by not being Oscar Wilde." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Jason add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "The certainty that everything has already been written annuls us, or renders us phantasmal." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jason add a quote by Hafiz
item.description:
"The sun never says to the earth, 'You owe me.'
Look what happens with a love like that. It lights up the whole sky." -- Hafiz

item.title: Jason add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin." -- Aldous Huxley
